tweets.text:
The capping of Walleys Quarry is going according to plan.

@EnvAgencyMids checklist

1.  Operator behind schedule ✅
2.  Smell is getting worse ✅
3.  Residents complaints increase ✅
4.  EA scratching their heads ✅

Environment agency happy ✅
Residents happy ❌

#StopTheStink https://t.co/2G7ObJaYhG

tweets.text:
Arrived back home yesterday after a few days away and the whole house stunk of hydrogen sulphide (rotten eggs). The smell came in again last night while we were trying to sleep. 

It’s incredible how this is being tolerated by @EnvAgency @PHE_uk. #StopTheStink #CapItOff https://t.co/hEjtRc0y5f

A town that has to buy air purifiers because they can’t breathe&are afraid of getting lung cancer from hydrogen sulphide fumes.The town that buy them themselves for the people who can’t afford to. Shame on you @RedIndustries2 @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/nAkcRqVur7

#StopTheStink we should be able to enjoy time in our own homes have friends safely following government guidelines in our gardens. @RedIndustries2 @PHE_uk @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson @MattHancock @DefraGovUK @JamesBevanEA this needs closing down https://t.co/B4g7rrzkv8

tweets.text:
@Olliecological @severnrivers @SevernUnlocked @NatResWales For the uninitiated in a healthy river you would normally expect to see background levels of phosphate somewhere in the region of 0.005 to 0.05mg/l and certainly not anything like 0.15 mg/l. 

In plain English this river is slowly been poisoned.

We can’t breathe upstairs. We received a letter today from the @EnvAgency after suffering since we moved here in 2016 - it feels like a kick in the teeth that it’s taken this long for the EA to do anything. In the pocket of Red #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk
@SimonTagg @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/6rBvWjfY0g

Enough is enough the @EnvAgencyMids have failed us @ClareDinnisEA you should be held personally responsible, you are allowing all of us and our children to be poisoned you need to go. #sackclaredinnis

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it’s clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.

@AaronBell4NUL @tom_marty @DrMickSalt And amazingly @PHE_uk have,in other words, said to residents “just deal with it”. This is NOT good enough. We are suffering night after night! It’s no longer “brief” exposure, we are getting the gases constantly now and inside our homes! @EnvAgencyMids do something!#stopthestink https://t.co/Q8mTiIEtiw

@hackneymartian @SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @RomanGeezer @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix That's good to see. Reporting pollution is a key part of preventing it. Thank you @RomanGeezer & @markroffey 
Next steps - will the Environment Agency act on the information from Thames Water? How often has the Env Agency inspected the industrial estate? Permits checked?

This is NOT going in our streams 😦 (investigating types of mink rafts)
It is not ok to put polystyrene in rivers. 
Product not fit for purpose. #plasticpollution #WatercressAndWinterbournes @HeritageFundUK @WessexRivers @EnvAgency https://t.co/BX5NGbzwjn
@tfortysix @RomanGeezer @SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn Of course. It's possible to have 2 containers on a tanker, I would think.
@hackneymartian @RomanGeezer @SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn Was the hose coming from the tanker?

@RomanGeezer @SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix I didn't stay for the whole process but they had a tanker there. The pollution was mostly dried out so I'm imagining they were getting it back into solution/suspension so they could suck it out.

@hackneymartian @SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix I’m no expert, but is he just washing it away? I hope not, surely there’s something extracting it?

@SaveLeaMarshes @HMUG_Hackney @RomanGeezer @StonebridgeLock @EnvAgencySE @LDNWaterkeeper @theriverstrust @DrCSyn @tfortysix Photo scoop! Thames Water team arrived while I was at Shortlands sewer this afternoon. They'd traced the culprit in the adjacent industrial estate & served a notice. The green dye is their tracer. They began the cleanup (worker photo with permission). https://t.co/mvMsIjnQqF
